definition: (dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to stroll/to walk (an animal)
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]

sentences.english: Soon it was time for my friend to take Jack for his walk.
sentences.chinese: 很快，我的朋友带杰克遛弯的时间到了。

sentences.english: He rambled in the park every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨在公园中遛弯儿。

sentences.english: It's quite a nice area to just meander and just to walk around.
sentences.chinese: 这是个遛弯散步的好去处。

sentences.english: I'll feed it, bathe it and walk it every day!
sentences.chinese: 我会给它喂食，给它洗澡，每天带它出去遛弯。

sentences.english: In fact, she is not even allowed to walk down the road.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，她甚至连遛弯的机会都没有。

definition: erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]
to walk a dog
to stroll/to walk (an animal)
to take a dog for a walk
to stroll/to go for a walk
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to have a stroll
to catch the wind/to go for a spin in the fresh air
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
to wander aimlessly
to stroll
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to cycle
morning exercise
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
